Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.17) Gecko/20110420 Firefox/3.6.17

If I have several profiles and the profile manager lets me choose, which profile I want to use if i klick on a .lnk-shortcut or on a link in e.g. Thunderbird.
If a window is open using the profile I choose to open that link, I get the message:
"Firefox cannot open the profile "XY" because it is in use.
To continue, close the running instance of Firefox or choose a different profile."


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create different profiles
2. don't set any profile as default, so when you open firefox, the profile manager lets you choose the profile
3. open a firefox window.
4. now open (in windows an .lnk- ) shortcut or an link in thunderbird.
5. choose the profile which was already used to open a window in step 3.
6. you get the report mentionned above


Expected Results:  
You can open shortcuts/links using any profiles even a firefox window of the profile you want to use to open the shortcut/link is already open.

comments.text:
I can also confirm this issue on the latest Firefox `64.0` on openSUSE Tumbleweed.

Please let me elaborate a little why this issue is a deal-breaker for me, and the main reason why during the last few weeks I've transitioned away from Firefox towards Chromium.  (Although **I hate with all my heart** Chromium due to the fact that Google has melded itself even into the open-source variant, I have no choice...)

So I'm involved in two completely separate projects, and for each I have a separate GitHub and Trello accounts.  Now when I receive via email notifications from either project I use the `Open With` plugin to open that link (to either a GitHub issue or Trello card) in its respective Firefox profile.  However if I already have one window open I can't do that anymore, and instead I need to copy-paste it.

(In fact, by using the same plugin and with a custom script, I managed to open specific of sites (mostly involving authentication) in separate profiles, and leave my "main" Firefox profile for browsing with a more aggressive "blocking" and privacy policy.)

Moreover I found this issue (inability of opening "external" links in a particular profile that is already open) in may other posts on the internet, and I find it strange that Firefox, a major mature browser, doesn't support this simple feature...  (Despite the fact that "some time" ago it supported it via a hack involving `-remote` argument, which was subsequently removed: in [#1080319](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1080319).)
